newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's IUSA says to buy Reading Tube Corp.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's IUSA says to buy Reading Tube Corp.

text.p: Mexico's Industrias Unidas SA (IUSA), the holding company of cellphone firm Grupo Iusacell, said on Wednesday that its U.S. unit Cambridge-Lee Industries Inc signed a final agreement to buy the assets of U.S. copper tubing firm Reading Tube Corp.
"This operation, subject to normal closing conditions, should be consolidated around the 25th of this month," IUSA said in a statement.

IUSA did not say how much the deal was worth, but said the transaction "can be considered one of the most significant acquisitions by a Mexican company of a U.S. company since the approval of the North American Free Trade Agreement."
NAFTA came into force on January 1, 1994.
Reading Tube is based in Reading, Pennsylvania.
IUSA is one of Mexico's biggest makers of copper tubing products.

"This transaction gives our operations in Mexico and the United States a great strategic position which will give us the ability to put together in North America a copper business with sales, as a group, of more than $500 million," IUSA Vice President Carlos Peralta said, according to the statement.
The acqusition "will create one of the biggest groups in the world in production and distribution of copper tubing and related products," he said.
